page.title: 02Solihull - Facts and Figures
page.content: The Borough has a population of 199,200 and is in between Birmingham and Coventry. It covers 44,495 acres. It is mainly residential but does have one large rural area in its boundries. The motto on its coat of arms is{Urbs {in Rure.} It is in the centre of a motorway network and is very close to Birmingham Airport and a main line station. In 1970 it was chosen as a site for the{National Exhibition {Centre. Most of the people who live in Solihull own their own homes and 80% of the working population are proffessionals. To our surprise our survey showed that most people were born in the Birmingham area,but not surprisingly are now better accomodated.
